intro: Galium ambiguum, commonly known as the ambiguous wood-sorrel, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves that are often heart-shaped or ovate. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Galium ambiguum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its stems are usually prostrate or ascending, and it is often found in moist soils with partial to full shade.
